pr_title: FCCEUD-34 new proc topic - importing a module

timeline.message: fcceud-34 new proc topic - importing a module

timeline.bodyText:
I would say 'publisher or author' here. Currently these are the only 2 roles in the system, so practically speaking, that reduces the prerequisite to "you're logged in."
Although our environments do have an admin login currently, using the system as the admin user is unsupported. This would be particularly problematic once we implement some form of access control (i.e., you can only see the repositories you're associated with). It would be impossible to prevent the admin user from seeing everything regardless.
We may add more roles in the future (perhaps an admin role, distinct from the admin user), but those details haven't been ironed out.
timeline.author: benradey
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+[id="import_modules_{context}"]
+
+= Importing modules into {ProductShortName}
+
+Importing a module into {ProductShortName}.
+
+.Prerequisites
+
+* You are assigned a publisher or admin role in {ProductShortName}.

timeline.bodyText: Technically it would be any accessible Git URL, not just GitHub. Our instance of Pantheon will be behind the firewall, so internal instances of GitLab would also be fine.
timeline.author: benradey
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+[id="import_modules_{context}"]
+
+= Importing modules into {ProductShortName}
+
+Importing a module into {ProductShortName}.
+
+.Prerequisites
+
+* You are assigned a publisher or admin role in {ProductShortName}.
+* You are logged in.
+* You obtained the GitHub repository URL for the module you want to import.

timeline.bodyText:
the id should be similar to the module heading, I suggest changing the id to:
[id="importing-modules-into-pantheon_{context}"]
timeline.author: theashiot

replies.bodyText: done, changed ID and file name to correspond
replies.author: emarcusRH
